messages.message: didn’t get to it last night… will do it tonight instead :slightly_smiling_face:

Thank you!

Also, for test owners:
I also added some more info in the above doc to clarify the expectations... Basically, we need to:
1. Change the OCR engine to msft even though it’s default in these flows right now.
2. Verify the new output and update the source-of-truth if necessary.
none of my tests broke on dogfood, will take a look today to confirm/add changes
@Yash Aggarwal what do you mean by change the OCR engine? In my Flow, it’s already set to default. Is the change only for Flows that were set to something else?
My understanding is default has changed from using google ocr to using msft OCR. So the only flows possibly impacted are ones who used default.
What I mean is, if our .ibflowbin was already using default, then we don’t need to update it since it will just start running microsoft ocr?

What Yash means is that if your flow uses “default” as the OCR engine, the engine now becomes MS OCR (used to be Google). *This might cause your golden to break, because the OCR text might have small differences.* So, please check if you golden tests are consistently breaking, and update the golden data to fix the test :slightly_smiling_face:

looks like @lydia you did need to modify your test a bit :slightly_smiling_face: the failure of this `compile-and-run-flow-with-dataset-token-matcher` test is probably because of some change in the OCR result. after you confirm that the test output is fine, just copy the test output to be the new golden i think is all we need to turn it green again
